summary: goog.scope aliasing improperly applied to object property names in @typedef

comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Compile this file: goog.provide('foo.bar.baz'); goog.scope(function() { var baz = foo.bar.baz; /** * @typedef {{baz: string}} */ baz.SomeType; /** * @type {baz.SomeType} */ baz.instance = {baz: 'Foo'}; }); // goog.scope What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected output: No warnings. Actual output: foo.js:18: WARNING - assignment to property instance of foo.bar.baz found : {baz: string} required: {foo.bar.baz: string} baz.instance = {baz: 'Foo'}; What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? HEAD on Linux. Please provide any additional information below. Workarounds: (1) Enclose the property name in quotes or (2) Move the @typedef outside of the goog.scope.
thanks for the detailed report; i'll take a look.
This issue was closed by revision d6aa74f95878.
